Calcs module (refraction_render.calcs)¶

classes for solving Fermat’s principle:¶

FermatEquationsEuclid(n, dndx, dndy[, args])

Solver for light ray in a 2D Euclidian geometry for \(n=n(x,y)\).

FermatEquationsCurve(R0, n, dnds, dndy[, args])

Solver for light ray in a 2D Polar geometry for \(n=n(s,y)\).

UniformFermatEquationsEuclid(n, dndy[, args])

Solver for light ray in a 2D Euclidian geometry with \(n=n(y)\).

UniformFermatEquationsCurve(R0, n, dndy[, args])

Solver for light ray in a 2D Polar geometry with \(n=n(y)\).

classes for solving rays in atmospheric model:¶

Calc(FermatEquations_obj)

Base class for Calculators.

CurveCalc([R0])

Calculator used for calculating rays on a spherical earth in an atmosphere.

CurveNoRefraction([R0])

Calculator used for calculating rays on a sphere earth in no atmosphere.

FlatCalc(**std_atmosphere_args)

Calculator used for calculating rays on a flat earth in an atmosphere.

FlatNoRefraction()

Calculator used for calculating rays on a flat earth in no atmosphere.

class for solving standard atmosphere¶

std_atmosphere([h0, T0, P0, g, dT, …])

Object which calculates the standard atmospheric model.
